metadata.title: CVE-2024-33601 on Ubuntu 23.10 (mantic) - medium
metadata.description:
nscd: netgroup cache may terminate daemon on memory allocation failure TheName Service Cache Daemon's (nscd) netgroup cache uses xmalloc or xreallocand these functions may terminate the process due to a memory allocationfailure resulting in a denial of service to the clients. The flaw wasintroduced in glibc 2.15 when the cache was added to nscd. Thisvulnerability is only present in the nscd binary.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2024-33601` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

glibc-source - 2.38-1ubuntu6.3
libc-bin - 2.38-1ubuntu6.3
libc6 - 2.38-1ubuntu6.3
libc6-amd64 - 2.38-1ubuntu6.3
libc6-i386 - 2.38-1ubuntu6.3
libc6-prof - 2.38-1ubuntu6.3
libc6-s390 - 2.38-1ubuntu6.3
libc6-x32 - 2.38-1ubuntu6.3
locales - 2.38-1ubuntu6.3
locales-all - 2.38-1ubuntu6.3
nscd - 2.38-1ubuntu6.3
No subscription required

criterions.comment: glibc package in mantic was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '2.38-1ubuntu6.3').
